entry.title: Does George Soros Manipulate Global Order
entry.content:
A nexus is trying to alter political realities the world over. One name is imprinted on the narrative it’s trying to build. On Gravitas Plus, WION’s Palki Sharma Upadhyay brings you the story of George Soros.[1]

  1. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qQbVyHVmmKs ↩︎

entry.title: A Thousand Brains - A New Theory of Intelligence - Jeff Hawkins and Subutai Ahmad
entry.content:
Bestselling author, neuroscientist, and computer engineer Jeff Hawkins joins computational neuroscience researcher and software technologist Subutai Ahmad to discuss the recent book "A Thousand Brains: A New Theory of Intelligence" and how those concepts are being applied to Machine Learning.

For all of neuroscience’s advances, we’ve made little progress on its biggest question: How do simple cells in the brain create intelligence? Jeff Hawkins and his team discovered that the brain uses maplike structures to build a model of the world - not just one model, but hundreds of thousands of models of everything we know. This discovery allows Hawkins to answer important questions about how we perceive the world, why we have a sense of self, and the origin of high-level thought. “A Thousand Brains” heralds a revolution in the understanding of intelligence. It is a big-think book, in every sense of the word.

About the panelists

Jeff Hawkins is a well-known scientist and entrepreneur, considered one of the most successful and highly regarded computer architects in Silicon Valley. He is widely known for founding Palm Computing and Handspring Inc., and for being the architect of many successful handheld computers. Despite his successes as a technology entrepreneur, Hawkins’ primary passion and occupation has been neuroscience. From 2002 to 2005, Hawkins directed the Redwood Neuroscience Institute, now located at U.C. Berkeley. He is currently co-founder and chief scientist at Numenta, a research company focused on neocortical theory.

Hawkins also wrote On Intelligence in 2004, with Sandra Blakeslee. He has given over one hundred invited talks at research universities, scientific institutions, and corporate research laboratories. He has been recognized with numerous personal and industry awards and was elected to the National Academy of Engineering in 2003.

Subutai Ahmad is the VP of Research and Engineering at Numenta, bringing with him experience across real time systems, computer vision and learning. He previously served as VP Engineering at YesVideo, Inc. where he helped grow the company from a three-person start-up to a leader in automated digital media authoring. In 1997, Subutai co-founded ePlanet Interactive, a spin-off from Interval Research. ePlanet developed the IntelPlay Me2Cam, the first computer vision product developed for consumers. He has served as a key researcher at Interval Research.

Subutai holds a B.S. in Computer Science from Cornell University, and a Ph.D in Computer Science from the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign. While pursuing his Ph.D, Subutai completed a thesis on computational neuroscience models of visual attention.

Moderated by Peter Norvig.[1]

Get the book here: https://goo.gle/3vMY4Ok.

  1. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TS5zcTGiAH4 ↩︎

entry.title: The Offspring Drummer Fired Because He Can't Get Vaccinated
entry.content:
The Offspring drummer Pete Parada claimed in a statement online that he was fired by the band because he was unable to get vaccinated due to a pre-existing medical condition. Pete Parada also shared that he wishes The Offspring much success in the future.[1]

Thank you to Rock Feed for providing the audio commentary.[2]

Thank you to drummer Pete Parada for sharing this testimony on instagram.[3]

  1. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=38848-4Fpf4 ↩︎

  2. https://www.rockfeed.net ↩︎

  3. https://www.instagram.com/p/CSE_rkVnIgL/ ↩︎

entry.title: Robert Malone on the Covid Crisis - July 17, 2021
entry.content:
Dr. Robert W. Malone[1] is the discoverer of in-vitro and in-vivo RNA transfection and the inventor of mRNA vaccines, while he was at the Salk Institute in 1988. Aga Wilson at Free Voice[2] interviewed Dr. Malone on the current covid crisis.[3]

entry.title: Keiser Report - Through the Fiat Looking Glass
entry.content:
In this episode of Keiser Report, Max and Stacy look at the Red Queen syndrome of the US dollar since Nixon closed the window and everyone has had to work harder and harder to stay in the same place.

In the second half, Max continues his interview with Egon von Greyerz of GoldSwitzerland.com about the coming dollar reckoning as tension builds between the rising power of China and the fading one of the US.[1]

  1. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EmhYk_2V818 ↩︎

entry.title: Apple’s Assault on privacy with plans to detect child abuse pics
entry.content:
Apple’s privacy reputation is at risk due to its plan to scan photos on all US iPhones for ‘child abuse imagery’. Security researchers and experts are concerned that this scheme threatens privacy and encryption.[1]

  1. https://on.rt.com/be0t ↩︎

entry.title: The Persecution of Canadian Physicians During the Pandemic
entry.content: In this group interview four physicians from across Canada tell their stories of persecution at the hands of their governing bodies.
